result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A. Dettmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: revoked

11:27 a.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cf159, 16cm467 and 15cf58. Pfeifer states agreement/Morgan concurs. Discussion concerning jail credit in 15cf58. All parties in receipt of revocation packet in 15cf58. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea in 17cf159. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. In 16cm467-upon Stipulation of parties, Court rescinds DEJ, finds defendant guilty. Pfeifer/Morgan/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
15cf58
Jail - 12 months with Huber for all purposes. May serve in any county jail in State of Wisconsin.
Jail credit - 179 days
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

16cm467
Jail - 90 days - Imposed and Stayed
POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
To be collected by DOC as a courtesy
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO. 

17cf159
Count 1
Jail - 9 months - Imposed and Stayed

Count 2 
Wisconsin State Prison System- Imposed and Stayed
Initial Confinement - 3 years; Extended Supervision - 3 years
If statutorily eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program, Court finds defendant eligible.

Count 3
Jail - 9 months - Imposed and Stayed

All counts
POP - 4 years (pursuant to 973.09(2)(b)2)
CC/Supervision Fees
To be collected by DOC as a courtesy.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Probation in 16cm467 and 17cf159 will run CC to jail time in 15cf58 and each other.
If revoked, all cases and counts are to run consecutive.

Adj. 11:54 a.m.

10:05 a.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court, in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 17cf159, 16cm467, 15cf58. Court notes that Attorney Andrew Morgan is not present. Pfeifer states that all matters would have been resolved today. Defendant states he spoke with attorney about 2 weeks ago - assumed attorney would be here today. Court will have JA attempt to contact Attorney Morgan - Pfeifer states that sentencing hearing will be more complicated than usual and brings to Court's attention more time will need to be scheduled. Court informs defendant that he will be notified once Attorney Morgan is contacted. Bail continued. Adj. 10:09 a.m.

3:20 p.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf58, 16cm467 and 17cf159. Pfeifer statement to cases. Morgan statement; would like to see global resolution with all cases. Motion hearing scheduled in 16cm467 and revocation hearing scheduled in 15cf58. Bail continued. Adj. 3:26 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court with attorney Andrew MOrgan .  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:35
Calling 17cf159 - set for arraignment, 15cf58 for revocation and 16cm467 - motion to rescind DPA - 
PFeifer - proceeding with arraignment only today and other 2 cases will track -  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for September 19, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
includes revocation summary and cover letter
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 16, 2017 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
9:03 a.m. Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF177. Schiek speaks to agreement/resolution. In 15CF58, State moves to amend to possession of heroin, s. 961.41(3g)(am), Class I felony. In 15CF177, State moves to dismiss Ct. 1. Court grants State's motion to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF58 and dismiss Ct. 1 in 15CF177. Plea questionnaire & waiver filed. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF58 and Ct. 2 in 15CF177. Schiek statement to sentencing--victim impact compliance. Voorhees statement to sentencing. Court statement to sentencing--informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Court sentencing
15CF58
WHS
2 yrs. POP
CC/CV/DNA surcharge/Supervision fees
Appeal rights given

15CF177
120 days' county jail w/Huber
21 days' credit
CC - collected by DOC 
DNA sample
Appeal rights given

03:28 PM - Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees in receipt of Information, waive reading and enters not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.
State's Exhibit 1

02:28 pm - Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michlig states defense will stipulate to ID of defendant and to admission of May 13, 2015 police report to use for find of probable cause.  State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (May 13th police report) - Marked and Rec'd.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Arraignment scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:28 pm - Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

02:40 pm - Defendant Travis A. Dettmann in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is trying to retain private counsel.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
